title: Distance Migrant Education: Social Integration Process Through Universal Instructional Design

context.prior_knowledge: Basic social studies coursework completion and digital device usage experience
context.additional_context: Customized educational courses for migrant students with diverse cultural backgrounds, requiring accessibility assurance in a smartphone-centric, limited-technology environment.

learning_goals: Immigrant students enhance cultural understanding and communication competencies by utilizing both their native language and the local language (Korean)

Utilize digital learning materials designed according to Universal Design for Learning (UDL) principles to acquire core concepts related to social integration (cultural adaptation, laws, rights, etc.) at a rate of 80% or higher

Learners will select one community issue (e.g., language barriers, cultural conflicts) in multicultural project teams of 4–5 members, develop solutions in three stages (problem analysis → solution design → implementation planning), and submit final reports reflecting peer evaluation (agreement by ≥2 of 3 peers) and instructor feedback (≥4 of 5 rubric items met).

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
